title: Mathematical Modeling and Problem-Solving Through Storytelling

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and simple graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: A real-life problem-solving-centered course utilizing social studies contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can represent social phenomena (e.g., population changes, resource distribution) as mathematical models.
Learners can define problems and propose solution strategies independently in storytelling-based scenarios.
Learners can perform collaborative activities across modeling stages: real-world problem analysis → mathematical transformation → solution → result interpretation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
